meanings.definition: The shape or outline of an object viewed from above.
meanings.sent1: The planform of the house looked like a rectangle from the sky.
meanings.sent2: The architect sketched the planform of the garden on paper.
meanings.sent3: The planform of the cake was so perfect that it seemed too good to eat.
meanings.sent4: The planform of the city resembled a sprawling spiderweb of streets.
meanings.sent5: From the plane, the planform of the island appeared like a tiny speck in the vast ocean.

meanings.definition: A diagram or drawing showing the layout or arrangement of something.
meanings.sent1: The planform displayed the seating arrangement in the auditorium.
meanings.sent2: She studied the planform of the museum to understand the exhibit locations.
meanings.sent3: The planform of the board game confused the players with its intricate paths.
meanings.sent4: The planform of the city map guided tourists to popular landmarks.
meanings.sent5: The planform of the garden blueprint revealed the placement of each plant and flower.

meanings.definition: To design or create a planform for a specific purpose.
meanings.sent1: The engineer will planform the layout of the new building.
meanings.sent2: They decided to planform the seating arrangement for the event.
meanings.sent3: She will planform the schedule for the upcoming project.
meanings.sent4: The team will planform the strategy for the marketing campaign.
meanings.sent5: He carefully planformed the design of the website to ensure user-friendly navigation.
